On Wed, Apr 30, 2008 at 4:52 PM, Nick Gall <nick.gall@...> wrote:
>  The TAG finding on the use of metadata in URIs states that the use of FORM
> in a returned HTML representation effectively "asserts" or "assures" that
> the "assigning authority" is "supporting a class of parameterized URIs".
> This raises the following questions:
>
> Do you agree?

Yes.

> If so, then how long is such an assertion/assurance good for?

As long as the representation is considered fresh.  Check the cache headers.

Mark.
